result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey N Schliewe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine and costs to be paid $50.00 a month commencing 10/15/22 and the 15th of every month thereafter until paid in full or penalty of civil judgment for non-payment.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffrey N Schliewe

Notice of intent to pursue post-conviction relief

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

10:41 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo.
Defendant Jeffrey N Schliewe in court.  
Attorney J Andrew Herbers Jr. in court for Jeffrey N Schliewe.
 
Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the charge.

Court orders the following:	
Fine:  $316
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $200
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid at the rate of $50 per month, starting 10/15/2022 and the 15th of every month until paid in full.
Alternate:  Entry of a Civil Judgment
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on September 30, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.

10:24 AM Defendant Jeffrey N Schliewe in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 10:00 am.
